data.question: What is the general formula for the dysprosium-containing ionic liquids reported?
What property do the dysprosium-based ionic liquids display at low temperatures?
What is the melting point of compound 1?
Which compound is liquid at room temperature?
What is the yield of compound 2 when synthesized?
What is the role of dysprosium in the ionic liquids?
data.answer: To provide single ion magnet behaviour at low temperatures

data.question: What is the significance of the glass transition point for compound 2?
data.answer: It indicates the temperature at which compound 2 transitions from a hard and relatively brittle state into a molten or rubber-like state, which is 87°C

data.question: Why are dysprosium-based ionic liquids considered for high-tech applications?
data.answer: Because they combine the properties of ionic liquids with magnetic, electrochemical, optical, or catalytic properties originating from the metal incorporated

data.question: Can compound 1 be repeatedly melted and crystallized without decomposition?
Is the synthesis of compounds 1-3 achieved through metathesis reactions?
Do compounds 1 and 2 have the same crystal structure?
Is the blocking temperature for the dysprosium complexes higher than the temperature limit of the magnetometer?
Does the presence of multiple relaxation processes in compounds 1 and 2 indicate different individual ion anisotropy around DyIII centres?
Are the dysprosium-based ionic liquids reported to be catalytically inactive?
Does compound 3 display strong out-of-phase components of the ac susceptibility indicating strong quantum tunnelling resonance at zero dc field?
What is the effect of applying a dc field on the ac out-of-phase component of the dysprosium complexes?
data.answer: It increases the size of the ac out-of-phase component by up to an order of magnitude

data.question: What does the presence of two peaks in the plot of frequency dependence of the out-of-phase component of ac susceptibility for compounds 1 and 2 indicate?
data.answer: The presence of more than one relaxation pathway

data.question: Is the energy barrier for slow magnetic relaxation the same for compounds 1, 2, and 3?
What is the role of the carboxylate bridging mode in determining the magnetic properties of the dysprosium complexes?
data.answer: It influences the Dy-Dy distances along the chains, affecting the single ion magnet behaviour

data.question: Are the dysprosium-based ionic liquids reported to be environmentally unfriendly?
